Key Match Events: Andrew Benintendi's 10th-inning single secured a 4-3 win for the Chicago White Sox over the Los Angeles Angels.
Korey Lee hit a two-run homer in the second inning.
Lenyn Sosa hit a tiebreaking solo home run in the fourth inning.
The Angels had runners on the corners in the seventh inning but failed to score due to a double play.
Michael Stefanic tied the game at 3 with a bunt single on a squeeze play in the eighth inning.
Post-Match Reflections: White Sox interim manager Grady Sizemore commented on the team's focus and professionalism despite fan frustration.
Angels manager Ron Washington reflected on the team's inability to capitalize on scoring opportunities.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Chicago White Sox avoided a record-breaking 121st loss for the second straight game.
The Angels matched a franchise record with their 95th loss.
Others: A sparse crowd voiced their displeasure with White Sox chairman Jerry Reinsdorf during the game.
White Sox starter Davis Martin gave up two runs and three hits in 3 2/3 innings.
Michael Soroka allowed only one hit over 2 1/3 innings.
Angels' 1B Nolan Schanuel exited the game in the first inning due to a bruised right leg.
